definition: (once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
Honolulu, capital of Hawaii/also called 檀香山
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
Terengganu, northeast state of mainland Malaysia

sentences.english: Better to rule in hell than serve in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 寧在地獄當主，不在天堂爲奴。

sentences.english: It was through the power of his mind that Hanuman leapt over the sea.
sentences.chinese: 哈曼奴也是通常心智的力量去橫渡海洋。

sentences.english: He pressed all of the adult males into slavery.
sentences.chinese: 他逼迫所有成年男性爲奴。

sentences.english: He wanted to create teams of engineers to work with business-development staffers.
sentences.chinese: 而馬丁奴希望成立工程師小組與業務開發人員合作。

sentences.english: So Mr. Martino agreed to appoint team leaders to help coordinate.
sentences.chinese: 因此，馬丁奴同意指定小組領導協助協調雙方的合作。

sentences.english: Life is a horse, and either you rides it or it rides you.
sentences.chinese: 人生像一匹馬，你駕奴不了它，他便奴駑你。

sentences.english: He sells himself to Fu Shan as a slave to give them a decent burial.
sentences.chinese: 董永爲了安葬父母，賣身給傅善爲奴。

sentences.english: She was some peasant girl, doubtless, whom her parents had sold into slavery.
sentences.chinese: 她肯定是個農村姑娘，父母把她賣身爲奴。

definition: concubine/I, your servant (deprecatory self-reference for women)
Master (term used by servant)/Your Majesty/operator (of machine)
prisoner of war/to capture/to take prisoner/(old) northern barbarian/slave
Jurchen, a Tungus ethnic group, predecessor of the Manchu ethnic group who founded the Later Jin Dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] and Qing Dynasty
demon in Buddhism/poltergeist in temple that plays tricks on monks and has a taste for their food
(dialect) form of address for one's wife/polite form of address for a woman
